meanings.definition: To ride faster or farther than someone else.
meanings.sent1: She tried to outride her friend in the race.
meanings.sent2: He always manages to outride everyone on his bike.
meanings.sent3: The tortoise challenged the hare to outride him in the race.
meanings.sent4: Her determination to outride her limits was truly inspiring.
meanings.sent5: The wind seemed to whisper, urging her to outride her fears.

meanings.sent1: The skilled equestrian could easily outride his competitors.
meanings.sent2: She was determined to outride her own previous record.
meanings.sent3: The cowboy's horse seemed to want to outride all the others in the rodeo.
meanings.sent4: His passion for riding allowed him to outride any obstacles in his path.
meanings.sent5: The champion jockey knew he could outride anyone on the track.

meanings.definition: To ride beyond or outside of something.
meanings.sent1: The adventurous explorer decided to outride the boundaries of the map.
meanings.sent2: The cyclist planned to outride the city limits and explore the countryside.
meanings.sent3: The horse rider accidentally managed to outride the designated trail.
meanings.sent4: Her imagination could outride any constraints placed upon it.
meanings.sent5: The young rider's dreams were big enough to outride any limitations.
